evidence.text: 95. OJP’s application of 2 C.F.R. § 200.340(a)(4) to Plaintiffs is unconstitutionally vague
evidence.source_document: Class Action Complaint for Declaratory and Injunctive Relief
Class Action Complaint for Declaratory and Injunctive Relief

evidence.text: (A) Declare unlawful, vacate, and set aside OJP’s decision to conduct an en masse termination of the putative class members’ grants.
evidence.source_document: Class Action Complaint for Declaratory and Injunctive Relief

add_extracted.value: Declare unlawful, vacate, and set aside OJP’s decision to conduct an en masse termination of the putative class members’ grants

evidence.text: (B) Declare unlawful, vacate, set aside Defendants’ terminations of the putative class members’ grants.
evidence.source_document: Class Action Complaint for Declaratory and Injunctive Relief

add_extracted.value: Declare unlawful, vacate, and set aside Defendants’ terminations of the putative class members’ grants

evidence.text: (C) Declare that OJP’s terminations violate the Fifth Amendment’s Due Process Clause.
evidence.source_document: Class Action Complaint for Declaratory and Injunctive Relief

add_extracted.value: Declare that OJP’s terminations violate the Fifth Amendment’s Due Process Clause

evidence.text: (D) Declare that OJP’s terminations violate the separation of powers, the Take Care Clause, and the Appropriations and Spending Clauses.
evidence.source_document: Class Action Complaint for Declaratory and Injunctive Relief

add_extracted.value: Declare that OJP’s terminations violate the separation of powers, the Take Care Clause, and the Appropriations and Spending Clauses

evidence.text: (E) Declare that OJP’s terminations on the basis of Section 200.340(a)(4) are unlawful, including its interpretation that 2 C.F.R. § 200.340(a)(4) allows OJP to terminate a grant based on a “change” in agency priorities.
evidence.source_document: Class Action Complaint for Declaratory and Injunctive Relief

add_extracted.value: Declare that OJP’s terminations on the basis of Section 200.340(a)(4) are unlawful, including its interpretation that 2 C.F.R. § 200.340(a)(4) allows OJP to terminate a grant based on a “change” in agency priorities

evidence.text: (F) Declare that OJP’s terminations are arbitrary, capricious, an abuse of discretion, or otherwise not in accordance with law.
evidence.source_document: Class Action Complaint for Declaratory and Injunctive Relief

add_extracted.value: Declare that OJP’s terminations are arbitrary, capricious, an abuse of discretion, or otherwise not in accordance with law

evidence.text: (G) Preliminarily and permanently enjoin Defendants, their agents, and all persons acting in concert or participation with Defendants from enforcing, implementing, maintaining, or giving effect to the terminations of putative class members’ grants, including through the enforcement of closeout obligations.
evidence.source_document: Class Action Complaint for Declaratory and Injunctive Relief

add_extracted.value: Preliminarily and permanently enjoin Defendants, their agents, and all persons acting in concert or participation with Defendants from enforcing, implementing, maintaining, or giving effect to the terminations of putative class members’ grants, including through the enforcement of closeout obligations

evidence.text: (H) Preliminarily and permanently enjoin Defendants, their agents, and all persons acting in concert or participation with Defendants from re-obligating the funds used to support putative class members’ terminated grants.
evidence.source_document: Class Action Complaint for Declaratory and Injunctive Relief

add_extracted.value: Preliminarily and permanently enjoin Defendants, their agents, and all persons acting in concert or participation with Defendants from re-obligating the funds used to support putative class members’ terminated grants

evidence.text: (I) Preliminarily and permanently enjoin Defendants, their agents, and all persons acting in concert or participation from terminating Plaintiffs’ grants without notice and a reasonable opportunity to object prior to deprivation of their protected interests in grant funding.
evidence.source_document: Class Action Complaint for Declaratory and Injunctive Relief

add_extracted.value: Preliminarily and permanently enjoin Defendants, their agents, and all persons acting in concert or participation from terminating Plaintiffs’ grants without notice and a reasonable opportunity to object prior to deprivation of their protected interests in grant funding

evidence.text: (J) Preliminarily and permanently enjoin Defendants, their agents, and all persons acting in concert or participation with Defendants from declining to spend the funds that Congress has appropriated for OJP grants.
evidence.source_document: Class Action Complaint for Declaratory and Injunctive Relief

add_extracted.value: Preliminarily and permanently enjoin Defendants, their agents, and all persons acting in concert or participation with Defendants from declining to spend the funds that Congress has appropriated for OJP grants

evidence.text: (K) Preliminarily and permanently enjoin Defendants, their agents, and all persons acting in concert or participation with Defendants from terminating grants under 2 C.F.R. § 200.340(a)(4) on the basis of a “change” in agency priorities.
evidence.source_document: Class Action Complaint for Declaratory and Injunctive Relief

add_extracted.value: Preliminarily and permanently enjoin Defendants, their agents, and all persons acting in concert or participation with Defendants from terminating grants under 2 C.F.R. § 200.340(a)(4) on the basis of a “change” in agency priorities

evidence.text: (L) Stay the termination of the grants pursuant to 5 U.S.C. § 705.
evidence.source_document: Class Action Complaint for Declaratory and Injunctive Relief

add_extracted.value: Stay the termination of the grants pursuant to 5 U.S.C. § 705

evidence.text: (M) Enter judgment in favor of Plaintiffs.
evidence.source_document: Class Action Complaint for Declaratory and Injunctive Relief

add_extracted.value: Enter judgment in favor of Plaintiffs

evidence.text: (N) Enter an order in the exercise of the Court’s equitable powers that directs Defendants to take all steps necessary to ensure that OJP disburses funds to Plaintiffs in the customary manner and in customary timeframes.
evidence.source_document: Class Action Complaint for Declaratory and Injunctive Relief

add_extracted.value: Enter an order in the exercise of the Court’s equitable powers that directs Defendants to take all steps necessary to ensure that OJP disburses funds to Plaintiffs in the customary manner and in customary timeframes

evidence.text: (O) Require Defendants to submit status reports every 30 days after the date of the entry of the order to ensure prompt and complete compliance with the order.
evidence.source_document: Class Action Complaint for Declaratory and Injunctive Relief

add_extracted.value: Require Defendants to submit status reports every 30 days after the date of the entry of the order to ensure prompt and complete compliance with the order

evidence.text: (P) Award Plaintiffs their costs, reasonable attorney fees, and other disbursements as appropriate.
evidence.source_document: Class Action Complaint for Declaratory and Injunctive Relief

add_extracted.value: Award Plaintiffs their costs, reasonable attorney fees, and other disbursements as appropriate

evidence.text: (Q) Grant such other and further relief as the Court may deem just and proper.
evidence.source_document: Class Action Complaint for Declaratory and Injunctive Relief

add_extracted.value: Grant such other and further relief as the Court may deem just and proper
